content.description:
Left of

Rock Star

is a left leaning dike. Just left of this are some discontinuous cracks. Climbing these up to a left-facing corner/crack is this route. Getting stood up and getting in some pro can be a bit sketchy.

Start left of

War Games

below an obvious left facing corner system.

Climb the corner system to the summit. The crux is near the top.
content.protection: Carry a standard JT rack with gear to at least a blue Camalot.
content.location:
Start left of

War Games

below an obvious left facing corner system.

content.description: Climb a delicate slab, with a pure friction crux (5.10-), then power over a bulge (5.11) to more delicate smearing (5.10-) to the top.
content.protection: 6 bolts to a 2-bolt chain anchor. The crux is very well protected.
content.location: The face between Suffering Catfish and 39 Steps.

content.description: This is the right leaning crack on the left side of the south side.  Climb the crack, then face past a bolt to a two bolt anchor.

climbs.name: Suffering Catfish
climbs.fa: Todd Gordon, Dave Evans, Jim Angione & Marge Floyd, November 1988

content.description:
Climb a steep slab past a bolt, passing the left side of a horizontal crack (#3 Camalot or equivalent) on your way to another bolt. The top rounds off after the last bolt and is easier. Rap off bolts atop Rock Star/School Daze.

The manky bolts on this have been replaced which makes this a far more enjoyable endeavor, but this is still best enjoyed on a cool day so the marginal smears feel a bit more secure.
content.location:
Located on the south face of Sargeant Rock, between

School Daze

on the left and

39 Steps

on the right and just right of a large bush.

climbs.name: Rock Star
climbs.fa: (TR) unknown, FL: Todd Swain & Peggy Buckey 12/88

content.description: This route ascends the middle of the Sargeant Rock.  Start via easy face to gain a somewhat shallow crack.  Towards the end of the crack, a bolt is encountered ushering one up the face past two more bolts.
content.protection: Hands and smaller pro with 3 bolts.  Descend the backside.

content.description: This route is to the left of War Games.  It is the furthest route to the left. It goes up some thing cracks, up a face past a bolt or two, then up a thin crack with a piton.  One of the bolts is doubled up because one of the bolts isn't a good one.
content.protection: QDs for the bolts and FP...then small to med cams for the rest of the climb.
content.location: Far left side of the Sargeant Rock Area.

content.description: The route offers steep but positive climbing up the dike system with the added security of a wide crack/flare. Minimal protection is to be had, but the nature of the climb makes it feel secure. Two stars out of five.
content.location:
You'll find this short but enjoyable route on the south face about 30' right of

Suffering Catfish

. Look for a vertical dike system in the back of a chimney/flare.
